intro: Jacquinia mucronulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Campanulaceae family, characterized by its bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and has narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually blue or purple, and they bloom in late spring to early summer. Jacquinia mucronulata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local pollinators.
